alert.note: Alert for Little River (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:29PM CDT until July 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, southeast Oklahoma and northeast Texas, including the following counties, in southwest Arkansas, Little River. In southeast Oklahoma, McCurtain. In northeast Texas, Bowie, Morris, Red River and Titus. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 329 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Texarkana, New Boston, Clarksville, Boxelder, Nash, Hooks, De Kalb, Redwater, Maud, Red Lick, Dalby Springs, Leary, Avery, Annona, Almont, Beaverdams, Spring Hill, Lydia, English and Red Bank. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
